title: Return to Castle Wolfenstein
notes: Game starts, console spits log dump, crashes while executing cfg files.

title: Return to Castle Wolfenstein
notes: Crashes immediately after start. Even the game's engine-terminal crashes making me unable to read the error message.

title: Return to Castle Wolfenstein
notes: Launches to a gray screen and then almost immediately crashes. Native official Linux binaries available outside Steam but difficult to get working nowadays. Game source code was released, so unofficial enhanced native ports are available. (iortcw works great)

title: Return to Castle Wolfenstein: Multiplayer
notes: Single player crashes on start. Only Multiplayer works, Mouse is wonky in the menu. You will want patches to play on wide screen.

RTCW will crash on start when querying the OpenGL extensions string.
This can be solved by starting Steam with the __gl_extensionstringversion=17700 prefix (just add this line before 'steam' in the command line). This will limit the number of available OpenGL extensions (as it was the older 177.0 driver). Then the game will just run fine. Only works with nVidia proprietary driver.
title: Return to Castle Wolfenstein

notes: The game will crash when querying the OpenGL extensions string. To fix this; start Steam with the __gl_extensionstringversion=17700 prefix (just add this line in front of 'steam' in the command line). This will limit the number of available extensions (it behaves as the older driver 177.0) and the game will work fine after that. Only works with nVidia proprietary driver.
title: Return to Castle Wolfenstein

notes: Works great. Needed to download a unofficial patch by Knightmare to make It run. Launching the game without It will crash to desktop
title: Return to Castle Wolfenstein

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX Vega (VEGA10, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.14-arch1-1-ARCH, LLVM 8.0.0)
notes: Add MESA_EXTENSION_MAX_YEAR=2008 %command% to the steam game launch options to get it to start. Don't increase the resolution too much in the game's graphical settings, for me when setting it higher then 1080p it will crash giving an OpenGL error and refuse to start forcing me to delete the wolfconfig.cfg in the game's directory to get it too start again. Besides these minor issues the game runs absolutely great.
title: Return to Castle Wolfenstein

notes: Works perfectly. Unofficial patch is needed in order to work. Otherwise, it will crash upon launch. (This problem also occurs on Windows.)
title: Return to Castle Wolfenstein
